unnormalised: Someone asked me what's the deal with prices at D-Mart? Well, tbh, their pricing strategy is pretty aggressive. Like, you can find Surf Excel 1kg for ₹220 sometimes, which is a steal compared to the local kirana store that sells it for ₹250. And they have these crazy offers like "Buy 2 Get 1 Free" on stuff like shampoo and biscuits. My mom always stocks up on those!
normalised: Someone asked me what is the deal with prices at D-Mart? Well, to be honest, their pricing strategy is pretty aggressive. Like, you can find Surf Excel one kilogram for rupee two hundred and twenty sometimes, which is a steal compared to the local kirana store that sells it for rupee two hundred and fifty. And they have these crazy offers like "Buy two Get one Free" on stuff like shampoo and biscuits. My mom always stocks up on those!

unnormalised: Plus, they always seem to have those "Rs. 99" sections where you can find random household items. Last week, I got a cool little planter for just ₹99! And they also have these combo offers, like 2 packets of Maggi for Rs 25. It's always a good idea to check for the MRP though, sometimes the discounts aren't as amazing as they seem at first glance.
normalised: Plus, they always seem to have those "rupees ninety nine" sections where you can find random household items. Last week, I got a cool little planter for just rupee ninety nine! And they also have these combo offers, like two packets of Maggi for rupees twenty five. It's always a good idea to check for the M-R-P though, sometimes the discounts are not as amazing as they seem at first glance.

unnormalised: So, yeah, D-Mart's pricing is definitely a draw. But be warned, going on a weekend is a total zoo! Expect long queues at the billing counters – waited like 30 minutes last Saturday! Still, worth it for the deals, I guess.
normalised: So, yeah, D-Mart's pricing is definitely a draw. But be warned, going on a weekend is a total zoo! Expect long queues at the billing counters – waited like thirty minutes last Saturday! Still, worth it for the deals, I guess.
